page.title: 07Preston Trust Homes
page.content: The Trust Homes were established after Lady Herbert died in 1691.She left Â£6000 to Lord Torrington to build and endow an Almshouse for 12 poor women and 12 poor girls of Shropshire.The rights of nomination were left to Lady Herberts brother the 2nd Earl of Bradford.The present Lord Bradford maintains family connections as chairman of the Board of Trustees. Recent memories of the Trust Homes indicate that a group of local well to-do middle class ladies lived at the homes.The orphan children lived in one dormitory,they had to attend church twice on Sundays,wore uniforms called Tibbits and Sleeves,were allowed one visitor a month but could not go out of the gates.Lord Torrington gave Â£1000 to build a hall in the centre of the Almshouses,this is used by the people of Preston for village events.
